Key Match Events: Kwadwo Duah scored the opening goal for Switzerland after 13 minutes
Michel Aebischer scored his first international goal in the 45th minute
Breel Embolo scored the decisive goal in injury time
Pre-Game Insights: Hungary were expected to be a dark horse in the tournament
Switzerland were expected to be a strong team, but some thought they may be over the hill
Hungary's manager, Marco Rossi, advocated for relationism rather than positionism
Post-Match Reflections: Murat Yakin praised Breel Embolo's commitment to get fit and his medical staff
Marco Rossi said Hungary had a tactical misunderstanding in the first half
Murat Yakin said Switzerland's ability to hold the ball up made them feel safe
Miscellaneous Highlights: Switzerland's Ricardo Rodriguez made his 116th appearance for the national side
The match was played in the Cologne Stadium, where Switzerland previously lost to Ukraine in 2006
Hungary conceded a goal in transition, which was a concern for their coach
Others: Switzerland's focused energy and targeting of Hungary's left wing-back, Milos Kerkez, was a key factor in their win
